snippet: The New York Youth Symphony, which champions new music, presented a premiere of the composer’s work at Carnegie Hall.
abstract: Vivien Schweitzer reviews premiere of Tonia Ko symphony Strange Sounds and Explosions Worldwide, performed by New York Youth Symphony at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The New York Youth Symphony, which champions new music, presented a premiere of the composer’s work at Carnegie Hall.

headline.main: Review: Tonia Ko’s ‘Strange Sounds and Explosions Worldwide’
headline.print_headline: A Combustible Planet, Forever Rumbling or Exploding in Flames
